Diagnosis. Carapace white and nearly circular; gastric, cardiac region well defined; dorsal surface of gastric region, frontal, orbital, anterolateral margins of carapace with minute granules; carapace dorsally flattened, nearly glabrous (
Fig. 2
). Frontal margin with lateral, median bifurcated spines, with 3 smaller sharp spines between large spines; frontal lobes separated by deep incision with minute spine on each side (
Fig. 14
a). Inner orbital margin with fine granules, ocular peduncle short, with granule near base of cornea.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 1.
Cymo andreossyi
, Red Sea records. Red circles refer to records from the literature, blue squares to material examined.

FIGURE 2.
Cymo andreossyi .
A, male, dorsal view; B, male, ventral view (Yemen, SMF 41727); C, female, dorsal view; D, female, ventral view (Yemen, SMF 41727). Scale bars, A, B = 1.4 cm; C, D = 1.2 cm; Photos: Sven Tränkner (SMF).

subSubSection.paragraph: Third maxillipeds densely setose; ischium subrectangular, separated from basis by indistinct suture; merus quadrate, antero-external edge angular. Heterochelous chelipeds in both sexes; merus trihedral, dorsal margin with small plumose setae, merus, carpus, propodus irregularly granular, granules largest on dorsal surface of carpus, propodus, carpus short; fingers smooth, tips of both fingers white, spoon shaped, both fingers of larger chela with 2 molariform teeth, smaller chela without molariform teeth. Walking legs short, tomentose, laterally compressed, their surfaces obscured by short setae, dorsal margins of merus, carpus, propodus with irregular small granules, dactylus hooked, with well-developed dactylo-propodal articulation.

Male abdomen relatively slender, slightly setose, segments
3 – 5
fused, segment 6 quadrate, telson triangular. Female abdomen sub-ovate, covering median part of thoracic sternum, lateral margins prominently setose, segment 6 widest, telson semicircular.

Lateral gastric teeth with anterior large tooth cusp, followed posteriorly by 8 smaller, mesially directed cusps (
Fig. 4
A), lateral side comprising 14 transverse comb-like lamellae; accessory teeth with semicircular row of 9 uniformly elongated single teeth; dorso-median tooth situated on the postero-ventral part of the urocardiac ossicle, consisting of transverse tooth cusp with row of small lateral spines at its base; cardio-pyloric valve arc-shaped, dorsal surface covered with plumose setae (
Fig. 4
D).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 3.
Cymo andreossyi
(Yemen, SMF 41727), A–C, G1; D–F, G2; gsc. , sperm channel groove; sco. , sperm channel opening. Scale bars: A, B, D, F = 300 µm; C = 100 µm; E = 30 µm.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Remarks. Previously recorded from a number of localities along the Red Sea: Gulf of Suez (
Lenz 1912
,
Laurie 1915
,
Balss 1924
,
Calman 1927
), Senafir I., (
Balss 1924
), Gulf of Aqaba (
Balss 1924
,
Monod 1938
), Egyptian coast (
Balss 1924
,
Ramadan 1936
), Saudi Arabian coast (
Balss 1924
), Sudanese coast (
Laurie 1915
,
Balss 1924
), Southern Red Sea (
Nobili 1906
,
Balss 1924
) (see table 1 ,
Fig. 1
).
Geographical distribution. Widely distributed across the Indo-West Pacific, from the Red Sea and the east coast of Africa to French Polynesia .
